channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: AudioToken: Adaptation of Text-Conditioned Diffusion Models for Audio-to-Image Generation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel method utilizing latent diffusion models trained for text-to-image-generation to generate images conditioned on audio recordings.

item.title: Measuring Inductive Biases of In-Context Learning with Underspecified Demonstrations
item.description: We investigate the inductive biases of ICL from the perspective of feature bias: which feature ICL is more likely to use given a set of underspecified demonstrations in which two features are equally predictive of the labels.

item.title: Ambiguity Meets Uncertainty: Investigating Uncertainty Estimation for Word Sense Disambiguation
item.description: Word sense disambiguation (WSD), which aims to determine an appropriate sense for a target word given its context, is crucial for natural language understanding.

item.title: Can We Edit Factual Knowledge by In-Context Learning?
item.description: Inspired by in-context learning (ICL), a new paradigm based on demonstration contexts without parameter updating, we explore whether ICL can edit factual knowledge.

item.title: Language Models for German Text Simplification: Overcoming Parallel Data Scarcity through Style-specific Pre-training
item.description: Moreover, with the style-specific pre-training, we reduced the number of trainable parameters in text simplification models.

item.title: Automated stance detection in complex topics and small languages: the challenging case of immigration in polarizing news media
item.description: We annotate a large set of pro and anti-immigration examples, and compare the performance of multiple language models as supervised learners.

item.title: Crosslingual Transfer Learning for Low-Resource Languages Based on Multilingual Colexification Graphs
item.description: This demonstrates the benefits of colexification for multilingual NLP.

item.title: ConQueR: Contextualized Query Reduction using Search Logs
item.description: One extracts core terms from an original query at the term level, and the other determines whether a sub-query is a suitable reduction for the original query at the sequence level.

item.title: Denoised Self-Augmented Learning for Social Recommendation
item.description: Social recommendation is gaining increasing attention in various online applications, including e-commerce and online streaming, where social information is leveraged to improve user-item interaction modeling.

item.title: Beneath Surface Similarity: Large Language Models Make Reasonable Scientific Analogies after Structure Abduction
item.description: Analogical reasoning is essential for human cognition, allowing us to comprehend new concepts by relating them to familiar ones based on common relational structures.

item.title: Flying Adversarial Patches: Manipulating the Behavior of Deep Learning-based Autonomous Multirotors
item.description: We introduce flying adversarial patches, where an image is mounted on another flying robot and therefore can be placed anywhere in the field of view of a victim multirotor.

item.title: Rethinking the Evaluation for Conversational Recommendation in the Era of Large Language Models
item.description: The recent success of large language models (LLMs) has shown great potential to develop more powerful conversational recommender systems (CRSs), which rely on natural language conversations to satisfy user needs.

item.title: funLOCI: a local clustering algorithm for functional data
item.description: Nowadays, more and more problems are dealing with data with one infinite continuous dimension: functional data.

item.title: LLMs for Knowledge Graph Construction and Reasoning: Recent Capabilities and Future Opportunities
item.description: This paper presents an exhaustive quantitative and qualitative evaluation of Large Language Models (LLMs) for Knowledge Graph (KG) construction and reasoning.

item.title: Restore Anything Pipeline: Segment Anything Meets Image Restoration
item.description: In this paper, we introduce the Restore Anything Pipeline (RAP), a novel interactive and per-object level image restoration approach that incorporates a controllable model to generate different results that users may choose from.

item.title: Prompt-based methods may underestimate large language models' linguistic generalizations
item.description: In this study, we compare metalinguistic prompting and direct probability measurements as ways of measuring models' knowledge of English.

item.title: Target-Aware Generative Augmentations for Single-Shot Adaptation
item.description: We argue that augmentations utilized by existing methods are insufficient to handle large distribution shifts, and hence propose a new approach SiSTA, which first fine-tunes a generative model from the source domain using a single-shot target, and then employs novel sampling strategies for curating synthetic target data.

item.title: Non-Autoregressive Document-Level Machine Translation (NA-DMT): Exploring Effective Approaches, Challenges, and Opportunities
item.description: Non-autoregressive translation (NAT) models have been extensively investigated within the context of sentence-level machine translation (MT) tasks, demonstrating comparable quality and superior translation speed when contrasted with autoregressive translation (AT) models.

item.title: Fact-Checking Complex Claims with Program-Guided Reasoning
item.description: Fact-checking real-world claims often requires collecting multiple pieces of evidence and applying complex multi-step reasoning.

item.title: Mitigating Catastrophic Forgetting for Few-Shot Spoken Word Classification Through Meta-Learning
item.description: We consider the problem of few-shot spoken word classification in a setting where a model is incrementally introduced to new word classes.

item.title: Federated Learning of Medical Concepts Embedding using BEHRT
item.description: Therefore, the EHR data from the medical centers often cannot be shared, making it difficult to create prediction models using multi-center EHR data, which is essential for such models' robustness and generalizability.

item.title: Logical Entity Representation in Knowledge-Graphs for Differentiable Rule Learning
item.description: A LERP is designed as a vector of probabilistic logical functions on the entity's neighboring sub-graph.

item.title: Rethinking Semi-supervised Learning with Language Models
item.description: Semi-supervised learning (SSL) is a popular setting aiming to effectively utilize unlabelled data to improve model performance in downstream natural language processing (NLP) tasks.

item.title: POEM: Polarization of Embeddings for Domain-Invariant Representations
item.description: Handling out-of-distribution samples is a long-lasting challenge for deep visual models.

item.title: Text-to-SQL Error Correction with Language Models of Code
item.description: Thus, we propose a novel representation for SQL queries and their edits that adheres more closely to the pre-training corpora of language models of code.

item.title: Neural Cellular Automata Can Respond to Signals
item.description: Neural Cellular Automata (NCAs) are a model of morphogenesis, capable of growing two-dimensional artificial organisms from a single seed cell.

item.title: EMEF: Ensemble Multi-Exposure Image Fusion
item.description: In the second stage, we tune the imitator network by optimizing the style code, in order to find an optimal fusion result for each input pair.

item.title: DEGREE: Decomposition Based Explanation For Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) are gaining extensive attention for their application in graph data.

item.title: TADA: Efficient Task-Agnostic Domain Adaptation for Transformers
item.description: Our broad evaluation in 4 downstream tasks for 14 domains across single- and multi-domain setups and high- and low-resource scenarios reveals that TADA is an effective and efficient alternative to full domain-adaptive pre-training and adapters for domain adaptation, while not introducing additional parameters or complex training steps.

item.title: ControlVideo: Training-free Controllable Text-to-Video Generation
item.description: Text-driven diffusion models have unlocked unprecedented abilities in image generation, whereas their video counterpart still lags behind due to the excessive training cost of temporal modeling.

item.title: VanillaNet: the Power of Minimalism in Deep Learning
item.description: In this study, we introduce VanillaNet, a neural network architecture that embraces elegance in design.

item.title: DiffusionNER: Boundary Diffusion for Named Entity Recognition
item.description: In this paper, we propose DiffusionNER, which formulates the named entity recognition task as a boundary-denoising diffusion process and thus generates named entities from noisy spans.

item.title: Approximating a RUM from Distributions on k-Slates
item.description: In this work we consider the problem of fitting Random Utility Models (RUMs) to user choices.

item.title: RecurrentGPT: Interactive Generation of (Arbitrarily) Long Text
item.description: In addition to producing AI-generated content (AIGC), we also demonstrate the possibility of using RecurrentGPT as an interactive fiction that directly interacts with consumers.

item.title: GSURE-Based Diffusion Model Training with Corrupted Data
item.description: Diffusion models have demonstrated impressive results in both data generation and downstream tasks such as inverse problems, text-based editing, classification, and more.

item.title: FIT: Far-reaching Interleaved Transformers
item.description: Unlike original transformers, which operate on a single sequence of data tokens, we divide the data tokens into groups, with each group being a shorter sequence of tokens.

item.title: It's Enough: Relaxing Diagonal Constraints in Linear Autoencoders for Recommendation
item.description: Inspired by this analysis, we propose simple-yet-effective linear autoencoder models using diagonal inequality constraints, called Relaxed Linear AutoEncoder (RLAE) and Relaxed Denoising Linear AutoEncoder (RDLAE).

item.title: Self-Replication, Spontaneous Mutations, and Exponential Genetic Drift in Neural Cellular Automata
item.description: This paper reports on patterns exhibiting self-replication with spontaneous, inheritable mutations and exponential genetic drift in Neural Cellular Automata.

item.title: Policy Representation via Diffusion Probability Model for Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Popular reinforcement learning (RL) algorithms tend to produce a unimodal policy distribution, which weakens the expressiveness of complicated policy and decays the ability of exploration.

item.title: Cross-functional Analysis of Generalisation in Behavioural Learning
item.description: In behavioural testing, system functionalities underrepresented in the standard evaluation setting (with a held-out test set) are validated through controlled input-output pairs.

item.title: Multi-task Hierarchical Adversarial Inverse Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Multi-task Imitation Learning (MIL) aims to train a policy capable of performing a distribution of tasks based on multi-task expert demonstrations, which is essential for general-purpose robots.

item.title: Is Synthetic Data From Diffusion Models Ready for Knowledge Distillation?
item.description: Diffusion models have recently achieved astonishing performance in generating high-fidelity photo-realistic images.

item.title: Road Planning for Slums via Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Existing re-blocking or heuristic methods are either time-consuming which cannot generalize to different slums, or yield sub-optimal road plans in terms of accessibility and construction costs.

item.title: MvP: Multi-view Prompting Improves Aspect Sentiment Tuple Prediction
item.description: Generative methods greatly promote aspect-based sentiment analysis via generating a sequence of sentiment elements in a specified format.

item.title: Boosting Knowledge Graph Generation from Tabular Data with RML Views
item.description: We present our extension of Morph-KGC to efficiently support RML views for tabular sources.

item.title: Is Fine-tuning Needed? Pre-trained Language Models Are Near Perfect for Out-of-Domain Detection
item.description: Fine-tuning with pre-trained language models has been a de facto procedure to derive OOD detectors with respect to in-distribution (ID) data.

item.title: A Fractional Graph Laplacian Approach to Oversmoothing
item.description: In this paper, we generalize the concept of oversmoothing from undirected to directed graphs.

item.title: Interactive Data Synthesis for Systematic Vision Adaptation via LLMs-AIGCs Collaboration
item.description: Recent text-to-image generation models have shown promising results in generating high-fidelity photo-realistic images.

item.title: Regularization and Variance-Weighted Regression Achieves Minimax Optimality in Linear MDPs: Theory and Practice
item.description: Mirror descent value iteration (MDVI), an abstraction of Kullback-Leibler (KL) and entropy-regularized reinforcement learning (RL), has served as the basis for recent high-performing practical RL algorithms.

item.title: Explicit Personalization and Local Training: Double Communication Acceleration in Federated Learning
item.description: Federated Learning is an evolving machine learning paradigm, in which multiple clients perform computations based on their individual private data, interspersed by communication with a remote server.
